# Role Onboarding Checklist

## Purpose
This checklist ensures new team members in any role are properly onboarded with the necessary context, access, and understanding of OctoAcme's project management processes.

---

## General Onboarding (All Roles)

### First Day
- [ ] Complete HR/administrative onboarding
- [ ] Set up development environment (if applicable)
- [ ] Get access to core systems:
  - [ ] GitHub organization and repositories
  - [ ] Project management tools (boards, tracking)
  - [ ] Communication channels (Slack, Teams, email lists)
  - [ ] Documentation repositories
- [ ] Review [Project Management Overview](../octoacme-project-management-overview.md)
- [ ] Review [Roles & Personas](../octoacme-roles-and-personas.md) document
- [ ] Meet with manager for role expectations and goals
- [ ] Introduction to immediate team members

### First Week
- [ ] Review all relevant process documentation in `docs/` folder
- [ ] Attend daily standups and observe team dynamics
- [ ] Shadow 1-2 team members in similar or related roles
- [ ] Set up 1:1s with key collaborators
- [ ] Identify questions and knowledge gaps
- [ ] Review current project status and active initiatives

### First Month
- [ ] Complete role-specific onboarding (see sections below)
- [ ] Participate actively in team ceremonies (planning, retros, etc.)
- [ ] Take ownership of first small tasks or responsibilities
- [ ] Provide feedback on onboarding experience
- [ ] Schedule 30-day check-in with manager

---

## Role-Specific Onboarding

### Developer
- [ ] Clone relevant repositories and complete setup
- [ ] Review coding standards and contribution guidelines
- [ ] Complete first code review (as reviewer and author)
- [ ] Set up local testing environment
- [ ] Review CI/CD pipeline and deployment process
- [ ] Pair program with senior developer
- [ ] Submit first pull request
- [ ] Review technical architecture documentation

### Product Manager
- [ ] Review product vision and roadmap
- [ ] Access product analytics and metrics dashboards
- [ ] Meet with key stakeholders and customers
- [ ] Review existing user research and feedback
- [ ] Understand backlog prioritization framework
- [ ] Shadow customer interviews or usability sessions
- [ ] Review competitive analysis and market positioning
- [ ] Lead first backlog grooming session

### Project Manager
- [ ] Review active projects and their status
- [ ] Access project tracking tools and dashboards
- [ ] Review risk registers and decision logs
- [ ] Understand escalation paths and stakeholder map
- [ ] Review past retrospective notes and lessons learned
- [ ] Shadow experienced PM in meetings and ceremonies
- [ ] Take ownership of status reporting for one project
- [ ] Facilitate first team meeting or standup

### Release Manager
- [ ] Review [Release & Deployment Guide](../octoacme-release-and-deployment.md)
- [ ] Access release management tools and environments
- [ ] Understand version control and branching strategy
- [ ] Review rollback procedures and incident playbooks
- [ ] Shadow a full release cycle from planning to deployment
- [ ] Get trained on deployment automation and monitoring
- [ ] Review release metrics and success criteria
- [ ] Coordinate first minor release or hotfix

### QA Lead
- [ ] Review testing strategy and quality standards
- [ ] Access test environments and test management tools
- [ ] Review test coverage requirements and metrics
- [ ] Understand defect tracking and triage processes
- [ ] Review automated test frameworks and CI integration
- [ ] Shadow test planning and execution activities
- [ ] Review past quality incidents and lessons learned
- [ ] Lead first test planning session

### Data Steward
- [ ] Review data governance policies and compliance requirements
- [ ] Access data systems and governance tools
- [ ] Review data models, dictionaries, and lineage documentation
- [ ] Understand data quality metrics and monitoring
- [ ] Meet with data stakeholders (engineering, business, legal)
- [ ] Review data privacy and security requirements
- [ ] Audit first data workflow or pipeline
- [ ] Complete data governance training

### Community Facilitator
- [ ] Access community channels (forums, social media, Discord, etc.)
- [ ] Review community guidelines and code of conduct
- [ ] Read through recent community feedback and requests
- [ ] Understand escalation process for community issues
- [ ] Review community metrics and KPIs
- [ ] Shadow community engagement activities
- [ ] Meet with Product Manager to align on community priorities
- [ ] Respond to first set of community inquiries

### Technical Writer
- [ ] Review documentation style guide and templates
- [ ] Access documentation repositories and tools
- [ ] Review existing documentation and identify gaps
- [ ] Understand documentation review and approval workflow
- [ ] Meet with subject matter experts across teams
- [ ] Review documentation metrics (usage, feedback, etc.)
- [ ] Shadow documentation interview or review session
- [ ] Create or update first documentation page

### Process Owner
- [ ] Review all project management process documentation
- [ ] Access process metrics and KPI dashboards
- [ ] Review recent process improvement initiatives and their outcomes
- [ ] Meet with all role representatives to understand pain points
- [ ] Review past retrospective themes and action items
- [ ] Understand process governance and change management approach
- [ ] Shadow process review or improvement workshop
- [ ] Facilitate first process retrospective or review

---

## Success Indicators

By the end of onboarding, new team members should be able to:
- Understand their role, responsibilities, and success metrics
- Navigate key systems and tools independently
- Identify the right people to ask for help or collaboration
- Understand how their role fits into the broader project lifecycle
- Contribute meaningfully to their first assigned tasks
- Provide constructive feedback on the onboarding experience
